title: 'I can't even imagine so many deaths'
description: Health and Science Reporter Laura Foster tries to help us understand the impact Covid-19 has had on the UK.

title: Djokovic court case: Could he argue his way to the Open?
description: How did Djokovic breach Australia's laws and could he argue his way into the Australian Open?

title: Novak Djokovic: Having Covid gave tennis star vaccine exemption - lawyers
description: Novak Djokovic's lawyers say a positive test on 16 December allows the tennis star entry to Australia.

title: Cladding: More flat owners to be freed from bills
description: Developers to be told to pay for removal of cladding in lower-height buildings, the BBC understands.

title: GB's Bankes earns second World Cup victory of season
description: Briton Charlotte Bankes' preparations for February's Winter Olympics continue to gather momentum as she claims a second snowboard cross World Cup win of the season.

title: 'It's better than the M25' - Billings drives 500 miles to join England squad in Sydney
description: Sam Billings answers the call to solve England's Ashes injury crisis by driving more than 500 miles from the Gold Coast to Sydney.

title: Covid: No need for a fourth jab yet, say UK advisers
description: The booster third dose continues to give high protection to people 65 and over, data suggests.

title: Covid: I'm unvaccinated and can't get fertility treatment
description: The Scottish government has deferred IVF treatment for unvaccinated women over Omicron concerns.

title: Covid: Different rules across UK causing fatigue, expert says
description: Changing coronavirus restrictions creates a "noise" and "uncertainty" in people, expert warns.

title: In Case You Missed It: New year, new adventure for these penguins
description: Watch our round-up if you want to "snow" what stories you've missed this week...

title: The Ashes: Khawaja's century for Australia leaves England battling to save fourth Test
description: Australia's Usman Khawaja hits another classy century to leave England needing to bat out the final day to save the fourth Ashes Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

title: The Ashes: Usman Khawaja's century leaves England fighting to save Sydney Test
description: Australia's Usman Khawaja hits another classy century as England are left needing to bat out the final day to save the fourth Ashes Test at the SCG.

title: The Ashes: Jack Leach takes two in two as Australia declare
description: England's Jack Leach takes two wickets in a row - including a golden duck for Alex Carey - as Australia declare on 265 on day four of the fourth Ashes Test in Sydney.

title: Kazakhstan unrest: Blinken questions Russian troop deployment
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken says reasons for sending about 2,500 Russian-led troops are unclear.

title: The Papers: Fourth jabs not necessary, and holiday 'stampede'
description: From new vaccine guidance to a rise in holiday bookings, Saturday's papers carry the latest on Covid.

title: Covid-19: Fourth jab not yet needed, and is this NHS crisis worse than ones before?
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Saturday.

title: Texas teacher 'locked Covid-positive son in car boot'
description: A witness reportedly called police after hearing someone in the trunk of the Texas woman's vehicle.

title: Families seek justice for Iran plane crash victims
description: Two years on, the families of downed flight PS752 victims are left without answers.

title: BBC reporter covered by snow flurry while filming
description: Laura Trevelyan's piece to camera in Washington DC is interrupted by a sudden white-out.

title: Sophia Duleep Singh: Princess and suffragette inspires children's book
description: Princess Sophia, who grew up in Suffolk, became a campaigner for women's rights in the 1900s.

title: Ros Atkins on... the US Capitol riot anniversary
description: Simmering tensions remain one year on from unprecedented scenes in Washington DC.

title: Week in pictures: 1 - 7 January 2022
description: A selection of powerful images from all over the globe, taken this week.

title: Dog theft: Fighting to bring Molly back home
description: Molly was stolen in July 2020. Her owner Ciara will never stop trying to find her.

title: How KFC in Kenya got fried over its chip shortage
description: Kenyans called for a KFC boycott after it was discovered that its fries were imported from Egypt.
